0:
- name: TZ
  value: "${TIMEZONE}"
- name: JAVA_OPTS_APPEND
  value: "-Djgroups.dns.query=keycloak-headless"
- name: KC_PROXY
  value: edge
- name: KC_HTTP_ENABLED
  value: "true"
- name: KC_HOSTNAME
  value: id.${DOMAIN_1}
- name: KC_HOSTNAME_STRICT
  value: "true"
- name: KC_HOSTNAME_STRICT_HTTPS
  value: "true"
- name: KC_LOG_LEVEL
  value: "org.keycloak.events:DEBUG,org.infinispan:INFO,org.jgroups:INFO"
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN
  value: "${KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_USER}"
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD
  value: "${KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASS}"

# - name: QUARKUS_TRANSACTION_MANAGER_ENABLE_RECOVERY
#   value: "true"

#   value: kubernetes

#   value: "${POSTGRES_SSO_USERNAME}"
# - name: KC_DB_PASSWORD
#   value: "${POSTGRES_SSO_PASSWORD}"

#   value: postgres

#   value: "postgresql.sso.svc.cluster.local"

#   value: ispn

# - name: KC_HTTPS_CERTIFICATE_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/tls.crt
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CERTIFICATE_KEY_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/tls.key
# - name: KC_HTTPS_TRUST_STORE_FILE
#   value: /opt/keycloak/conf/truststore.jks
# - name: KC_HTTPS_TRUST_STORE_PASSWORD
#   value: password
# - name: KC_HTTPS_CLIENT_AUTH
#   value: request
1:
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN
  valueFrom:
    secretKeyRef:
      name: keycloak-credentials
      key: user
- name: KEYCLOAK_ADMIN_PASSWORD
  valueFrom:
    secretKeyRef:
      name: keycloak-credentials
      key: password
- name: KC_DB_PASSWORD
  valueFrom:
    secretKeyRef:
      name: keycloak-db-postgresql
      key: password
- name: KC_PROXY
  value: "edge"
- name: KC_FRONTEND_URL
  value: https://sso.janz.digital/auth
- name: JAVA_OPTS_APPEND
  value: >-
    -XX:+UseContainerSupport
    -XX:MaxRAMPercentage=50.0
    -Djava.awt.headless=true
    -Djgroups.dns.query={{ include "keycloak.fullname" . }}-headless

0:
# Could use the above envar, but lets use the quarkus conf file
quarkus.transaction-manager.enable-recovery=true
# quarkus.http.non-application-root-path=/

- name: objectstore
  emptyDir:
    sizeLimit: 100Mi
- name: quarkusproperties
  secret:
    secretName: keycloak-quarkusproperties
    defaultMode: 0777

- mountPath: /ObjectStore
  name: objectstore
- name: quarkusproperties
  mountPath: /opt/keycloak/conf/quarkus.properties
  subPath: quarkus.properties

/hr/tccr.io-truecharts-metrics-server.title: metrics-server helm release
/hr/tccr.io-truecharts-metrics-server.name: metrics-server
/hr/tccr.io-truecharts-metrics-server.doc: Metrics Server is a crucial component of a Kubernetes cluster, responsible for collecting resource usage and performance metrics from the nodes and pods. It provides a centralized and scalable solution for retrieving cluster-wide metrics, which is essential for monitoring the health and performance of your home lab. With Metrics Server, you can easily track the utilization of resources such as CPU, memory, and network bandwidth, allowing you to identify bottlenecks and make informed decisions about scaling and resource allocation. Whether you're looking to optimize resource utilization or simply monitor the health of your cluster, Metrics Server is a must-have tool for any home Kubernetes user.
